meanings.sent1: The wabbler stumbled and almost fell.
meanings.sent2: The playground was full of happy wabblers playing tag.
meanings.sent3: The wabbler tried to dance but ended up looking silly.
meanings.sent4: She was a wabbler in the art of balancing work and play.
meanings.sent5: The little wabbler held onto the railing tightly as he climbed the stairs.

meanings.definition: To move unsteadily from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The boat wabblered in the rough waves.
meanings.sent2: The toddler wabblered across the room, learning to walk.
meanings.sent3: The penguin wabblered on the ice, trying to keep its balance.
meanings.sent4: Her heart wabblered with excitement as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The old chair wabblered every time someone sat on it.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a special wabbler to fix the engine.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen gadget was a handy wabbler for slicing vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The robotic wabbler malfunctioned and started spinning in circles.
meanings.sent4: The magical wabbler transformed into different shapes when activated.
meanings.sent5: The inventor proudly displayed his latest wabbler invention at the fair.
